testSteps.description: Send message button should be visible

assertions.text: Send button on the chat should be not be the default button whereas it should render as per the action taken by the user

evidence.description: Initial chat list view - no send button visible, user is not in a text input state
User has started typing in the Me chat - keyboard is visible but send button not yet prominent
As user continues typing 'Hello', a green circular send button appears in the bottom-right corner of the screen, demonstrating dynamic rendering based on user input
Message 'Hello test message!' is fully typed with green send button clearly visible and enabled
Message has been sent ('Hello test message!' appears in chat at 11:10 PM), input field is now empty
Back to chat list view - the sent message is visible in the Me chat preview, confirming the send button disappeared after sending

assertions.explanation: The assertion states that the send button should not be a default button but should render based on user action. The recording shows that when the message input is empty, there is no prominent send button visible (frames 0-4). As the user types 'Hello test message!' (frames 8-47), a green circular send button appears in the bottom-right corner (clearly visible from frame 27 onwards at t=5.4s). After the message is sent (frame 62 at t=12.4s), the send button disappears again and the input field is empty (frames 66-74). This behavior demonstrates that the send button dynamically renders in response to user input rather than being a persistent default button, confirming the assertion.
